Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, little more than average”
Reviews.Author: elomaili
Reviews.Content: This hotel fills the basic needs of a traveller, though there's nothing special or extra to it. The location is a bit far for walking to the top tourist sites, but the area itself is a lot more peaceful than, say, Sultanahmet district. The room we stayed in was very small and the walls were quite thin - I used earplugs so no problem with that at night... The room was kept clean very nicely. AC did not work at all, or we couldn't figure out how to use it. Wi-fi a bit weak and unstable. Average breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful. Next time in Istanbul we'll stay in another hotel, but if I hear that a friend of mine has booked this hotel I'll tell him: "It's ok".

Reviews.Title: “Nothing amazing”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel pleasant enough, but nothing special. The location is quite a good base for exploring the Old Town (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Tokapi palace etc). The rooms were clean but basic. Staff were a bit hit-and-miss; some very helpful and informative, other not so much. Breakfast, again, good but not spectacular. I have no real complains about this hotel, but wouldn't stay there again if I was to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Next year again!”
Reviews.Author: Rita R
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Hotel from Brazil I had no idea if being there would be a good place, you know only pics hmmm To believe or Not to believe lol But there I felt I had made a good choice, so my friend and I stayed there for 27 great days. I really recommend it. We stayed in the room 104, cleaned everyday by very nice lady who could hear us singing aloud in the morning :) Breakfast was OMG delicious , bread ( dunno know the name) was so good I miss it a lot, and the yougurt perfect!! The staff very gentle..guys YOU gotta be there you will love it as we did...Barin next year again..Room 104 yay!!

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: iannsa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just very average. It is fairly well located near a tram station, and a few minutes walk to Grand Bazaar, and a few minutes more to some of the other great tourist sites: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Sulemanye Mosque, etc. The hotel was clean, well presented, and the room i had was very neat. it had a separate lounge area, and the bedroom was just big enough for the bed and 2 bedside tables. Please beware of the taxi drivers - insist they charge you by the meter, and just walk away if they won't. i had an experience outside the hotel, and was disappointed that the hotel staff didnt intervene, but just suggested that i use public transport if i didnt want to pay the taxi drivers 'fixed rate' - however, Istanbul is a beautiful place to visit, and well worth a few more trips for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel near the old city”
Reviews.Author: Davide M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice! The hotel price is very good for the turist

Reviews.Title: “if they give you room 112: run away screaming!”
Reviews.Author: xdxdVSxdxd
Reviews.Content: the hotel is almost nice, but there are lots of details which just are no-good. Our room there: room 112. Little, dark, small. The window faces an internal cloister full of stairs and the worst imaginable smell from the kitchen. Continuous noise from the electric motors of all the air conditioners of all the other rooms never stops and is not even defeated by fully closing the window. And if you do close the window you will need to turn on the air conditioning in your room: noisy, and pointed right directly on your bed, so that either you die from the extreme heat (if you turn it off) or from the extreme cold (if you turn it on). We asked to change rooms: not possible. :( too bad Barin: there are much better places in which to sleep in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: egyptmmmx
Reviews.Content: The hotel reallly worth the money u pay for it , even they have gaved us the most smallest room they have but i must admit we have arrived 8 in the morning and they gave me the room at 10.30 which was very good touch from they part so ii didnt want to ask for anything more . the staff is ok not that much friendly and not bad they are so professional in dealing with guest and the reception speak good english , so no problem in communicate the breakfast is what do u expect from a decent 3 star hotel , is very good and tasty , orange juice was excellent as well as coffeee was ok the hotel is putting slipers , own safe in the room , LCD screen which i never find those 3 things in 3 stars hotel , so finallly i must rate the hotel as nearly 4 star in term of rooms & service with a very very affordable price Thanks again Barin Hotel for your good image you left in us P.S the smallest room i was in it was rooom#102( but honestly teh bathroom was large)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not prime location”
Reviews.Author: skybertha
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel, it was clean, the rooms were beautiful and comfortable, the staff was very friendly and the breakfast was excellent. I probably wonÂ´t be returning to the Hotel Barin any time soon, however, because of the location. It is just a bit too far from the major tourist attractions. You can walk to the Grand Bazaar easily, or take the tram to all the big sites, but if I could do it all over again I would definitely stay in Sultanahmet. Furthermore, the area surrounding the hotel wasnÂ´t the most appealing: itÂ´s full of shops selling knockoff retail!!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: tornea_mihail
Reviews.Content: good hotel for business travelers, it's clean and decent. standard breakfast. the rooms are small but comfortable. New LCD TV's and new Air conditioner. Free WIFI in the room. strong 3.5 star Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerEB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located - close to the main road (tram and metro to airport) but far enough from noise. Rooms are very clean and breakfast is excellent. Hotel staff are courteous. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “well kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: evaschw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well kept, good location near grand basar and serail, although in the russian quarter. Good breakfast, nice restaurant around the corner. Tram stop to the ferry station easily reachable. The only disadvantage (in winter) is, that you cannot switch off the heating and have to keep the windows shut during the night (noise!), so that the room is quite hot all the time. In summer the AC should work. The wireless on the computer of the hotel does not work, if you bring your laptop, it is slow, but works.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK, just donâ€™t leave anything valuable in your room.”
Reviews.Author: Touho
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Barin a couple of nights. The service was good and friendly, breakfast was ok and rooms clean. Everything was like we expected things to be, except that my iPod disappeared from the room while we were out. OK, I might be a little naive leaving such things unguarded in the room, but I trusted that the things would stay in the closed travelling bag (a separate pocket closed with a zipper) â€“ the player was not on the table in front of everyoneâ€™s eyes or anything. Unfortunately I noticed this only after arriving back home. So, I sent an email to the hotel asking how this could have happened, in a matter-of-fact style, asking for a reply. No response at all. This way the hotel gives its silent acceptance to this, which in my opinion is the worst thing in this case. Iâ€™m not worrying after the lost player, it was not that expensive, but the thing that itâ€™s OK for the hotel that these things just happen. My opinion as a traveler is, that it should not. Bottom line: Value for money, which (among all other valuables) should not be left in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beware ! What the Barin Hotel Did, was not fair !”
Reviews.Author: vinn_2k
Reviews.Content: After going through reviews of various hotels, I finally picked on Hotel Barin because of its location, recent renovation, good reviews etc.... I arrived at the Barin at 7.45 am after a long bus journey from Cappadocia. There was this elderly receptionist guy at the reception on the 2nd October. I presented him my voucher and he asked me to wait till as it was very early. I agreed. At 10.30 am, I went to him and asked him, how long more I have to wait..... and he told me, " did u hear the tok, tok noise?" I said No, why?, oh there is some renovation happening, and no water in the rooms, and dont worry, I have a better hotel for you, it is 4 star, just opposite, and very good breakfast and I will transfer you immediately.... And he transferred me to The Washington Hotel...... It all happened so fast, I had no time to argue.... I was also very tired, and wanted to visit the toilet and hit the bed ! On reaching the Washington, I found out it was 3 star not 4, an old property, musty rooms, small rooms, stained carpets - all black and brown, a very tiny toilet with a faucet that was difficult to use, and the coldest breakfast I every ate..... ice cold omlettes, salads, bread and everything else. We were only there for a night, so didnt want to argue, but I felt this was totally unfair. We spend a lot of time trying to go through reviews, choose a hotel of our liking, and then to finally be dumped in a totally strange place which I am forced to stay in is unwaranted and uncalled for ! Thank god the location was the same, and there were nice places around to eat, but the Barin Hotel should think twice before dumping confirmed guests elsewhere. If their rooms were under renovation, they had no business to confirm a room in the first place ! I am also taking this matter up with the people that confirmed the Barin !

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Derek17
Reviews.Content: Have just returned after 3 night stay at BARIN.Found hotel very central as regard getting to tram which was only a few stops from main sightseeing venues.Hotel was very good,clean and staff very obliging.Would recommend:FLAMING POT: dish in DIANA restaurant around corner

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LNT66
Reviews.Content: Compared with other hotels in the area this is one of the best (looking). It is basic, but clean and well located, only 5 mins from the tram or a 20 min walk to the main sites in the old city. The room was pleasant, quite big and the bathroom was clean with a shower\bath. The air con was good and the wifi free. Breakfast was included and was good, typical continenetal type with some local dishes too. The surrounding area seems a bit scary initially as there are a lot of young men on the streets selling fake bags, clothes etc, however, they tend to leave you alone and even returning late at night felt safe, compared to London! If you are prepared to eat just about anywhere then walking back from the centre to the hotel offers you the opportunity to eat at some local places...

Reviews.Title: “great base, clean, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sam_kus
Reviews.Content: I booked thÄ±s hotel havÄ±ng read the revÄ±ews and searched the Ä±nternet for budget accomodatÄ±on. I booked through clÄ±ck travel and got a bargaÄ±n. The metro from the aÄ±rport brÄ±ngs you close to the hotel wÄ±th an addÄ±tÄ±onal short walk or tram rÄ±de to the bottom of the hotels street. The hotel was clean wÄ±th frÄ±endly staff. Its locatÄ±on Ä±s Ä±deal for seeÄ±ng the sÄ±ghts. It about 20mÄ±ns walk to the blue mosque and about 10mÄ±ns to the grand bazaar. The tram at the bottom of the street can take you to the sÄ±ghts for 1 and a half lÄ±ra Ä±f you dont fancy a walk. The room was quÄ±te small but modern wÄ±tha flat screen tv and a mÄ±nÄ± bar. The shower was always hot and the aÄ±r con Ä±n the room made Ä±t easy to sleep through the nÄ±ght. The breakfast Ä±s a buffet wÄ±th somethÄ±ng for everyone, altough Ä±t does get busy at 9am. When I return to Istanbul I would stay Ä±n thÄ±s hotel agaÄ±n. Forgot to say that the receptÄ±on staff spoke good englÄ±sh.

Reviews.Title: “Real value for money and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Suesunshine255093
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barin Hotel for 8 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and reasonably updated. The breakfast was really good. The staff were helpful and spoke good English. I would not hesitate to stay there again and I have recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “No sound proofing!”
Reviews.Author: klpdietis
Reviews.Content: Very noisy hotel, it may be the have papier walls ? U can hear every word and every breath your neighborhoods in another room, sound from the street u can hear with eny problems too. Breakfast every day the same.

Reviews.Title: “another real bargain”
Reviews.Author: marathonmad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced,clean,provides a fridge and a safe,and has a great breakfast.For the latter your choices are scrambled eggs with tomatos and onions,chicken sausage (yuk),deep fried rolled crepes,hard boiled eggs,soup,great yoghurt with a choice of 4 fruit toppings,a sweet roll,sliced cucumbers,tomatos,chicken ham(again yuk),white and yellow cheese,2 kinds of bread,4 kinds of cereal,milk,orange drink,coffee,tea..something for everyone.............and free internet.TIP!!!!!!!!!! do not take the taxi etc from the airport,take the Metro ca $1,the the tram to the stop nearest the Crowne Plaza Hotel ( on your LHS going into town),another $1,get off.Walk up the hill next to the CPH,and the Barin is easy to fid or ask.You will save BIG bucks this way,if it is raining.....another story.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: StephSuffolkEngland
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night break to Istanbul. We paid Â£130.00 for return flight and accommodation with breakfast per person. This hotel was great value for money. It was clean, service was very good. The rooms were quite small but very clean, the bathroom was clean, towels were changed each day and hot water was always available. The maid came in each day to clean the room. This hotel is in a good location not too far from the main attractions. Brilliant value, would recommend for a city break, says 3 stars and in my opinion of experiencing many city breaks it certainly was of 3 star standard

Reviews.Title: “"EXACTLY WHAT IT SAYS ON THE BOX"”
Reviews.Author: shabzay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barin Hotel for 7 Nights in October/ November 2009. As we arrived in Istanbul at night, the hotel was difficult to locate; But the next mnorning we realised it is located close to both Laleli and Aksaray tram stations. We had booked a double room, but the room offered had 3 single beds; The next day, this was remedied. The rooms are clean, but small. The satelite TV did not have very good reception and the was a lack of English Channels. The hotel is however quite noisy. The shower head kept slipping down (but used my wifes stocking to hold it up !!!!!). Breakfast was very basic, warm bread rolls, eggs, selection of cold meats, fruit, coffee and tea. We tried to use the internet, but found it slow and the keyboard was different (not easy unless you are computer geek)

Reviews.Title: “Good address for a quiet stay for accaptable money”
Reviews.Author: swissadwiser
Reviews.Content: Good situated (short-distance from tram station but still in quiet area) this hotel surpised positively with its cleanliness and good value for money. Breakfast was nice too. Staff, however was not too friendly (compared too other Turkish people which I found generally very hospitable) and internet did not work at all time. Room was not too large, but always clean and ordered. Would give it 3,5 *...

Reviews.Title: “Location-Location-Location”
Reviews.Author: boodleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barin for 3 nights during a trip to Istanbul to celebrate my 50th birthday. Although this is a "no-frills" tourist -class hotel, we found it a great place to stay during our first visit to Istanbul. The location was excellent with the hotel close enough to the main drag (Ordu Cd) to catch the tram/subway to/from the airport but far enough away to miss the traffic noise from this main through-fare. The first night in town we started to walk to get fimiliar with the neighborhood and before long we at the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Proximity to Laie University and the Grand Bazzar meant plenty of snacking at the university and the life and energy of droves of young people. We also found the hotel only about a 15-20 minute stroll to the Galata Bridge and Eminou docks to catch the Bosphorus cruises and eat the delicious and affortable fish sandwiches sold along the waterfront. The hotel staff was very friendly and efficient and the breakfast buffet was a great touch and although fairly simple, was very interesting. There were plently of affordable restaurants along the Ordu Cd. with most of the tourist spots located in Sultanamet. All-in-all, I would highly receommend this hotel to travellers on a budget and would more than receommend the great-crazy-bustling-exciting-historic and extremely friendly city of Istanbul! My hats off to the Turkish people and their grand city.

Reviews.Title: “A two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sancho05
Reviews.Content: The location is good, you can walk to the main tourist attractions or take the tram a few metres away. Rooms and bathrooms are clean. The staff is just correct, not specially friendly or willing to help. We had to change our room twice. Our first room was too small and twin-bedded. The second one had a French bed but it was on the first floor overlooking the fire scape. The window had bars and the room was dark at all times. Not to mention the mattress, which was very old and uncomfortable, the shower head slid down and you couldnÂ´t have a shower unless you were a pygmy or pick it up with your hands. Finally the third room was ok. It was on the street side and it was big. So, depending on the room, you can have a good or bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Barin Hotel during my trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mikica83
Reviews.Content: This is my first solo trip outside former Yugoslavia, and I have chosen Barin Hotel based on reviews by other people. I made my booking online, and since I had 6 nights, the hotel gave me free two-way transfer from/to Ataturk International Airport, and since this way my first stay in Istanbul, this was really nice! But you should note your departure from the hotel in order to get your transport to the airport. They are not going to take care of it on their own. Just talk to the receptionist one day before departure. Staff at the reception knows fair English, German and Russian. Most of the guests are Spanish and from CIS countries (Russia, Ukraine and so on). The hotel is located in a quiet street so late in the night you could hear people talking on the street. My room was totally OK, and altough this is a 3* hotel, I must say that the furniture and decoration is like in a 4* + hotel. Room was equipped with a small TV set, 1 floor and 2 table lamps, air-conditioning unit, wardrobe and a safe box (usage of it is free of charge! ). Maid kept the room clean and every day I had clean towels and two new soaps. Breakfast is served from 7 until 10 a.m. It consists of: ham, cheese, feta cheese, 3 types of cereals, milk, bread, sausages, eggs, jam & marmelade, tomatoes, cucumber and butter. One could drink yoghurt, orange juice, coffee or turkish black tea. Tables were clean, and food was plentyful. Hotel is 5 minutes away from tram stations Laleli Univerzitesi and Aksaray, so you can choose from which on to go.

Reviews.Title: “Best price, best location, best...”
Reviews.Author: Prince91
Reviews.Content: As I had congress meetings closer to the airport this was perfect location â€“ 5 min to Aksaray metro station that goes directly to airport for only 1.5 TYL. In my free time this was excellent point for going to the old center. If you do not want to pay to much for your meal itâ€™s best you go down in direction of the cost where only Turks are. Prices are 5 times lower than in the centre. Room was grate â€“ air conditioning, TV, everyday cleaning, nice and tasty breakfast. And price I paid was like in the hostel. Thus, this was perfect experienceâ€¦
